articles.author: Darragh McDonald
articles.description: The Royals are going to be reinstating Michael Lorenzen from the 15-day injured list on Saturday, which will bump left-hander Bailey Falter to the bullpen. Manager Matt Quatraro relayed the news to Anne Rogers of MLB.com. It’s an unfortunate development for Falter, who has been having a good season overall. He logged 113 1/3 innings…
articles.title: Royals Move Bailey Falter To Bullpen

articles.author: Leo Morgenstern
articles.description: The Royals have agreed to a minor league contract with Nick Robertson, reports Ari Alexander of KPRC 2. The right-hander had spent most of the season in the Astros organization, but he was released today, according to the transaction log on his MLB.com player page. Robertson, who recently turned 27, appeared in the majors for…
articles.title: Royals To Sign Nick Robertson To Minor League Deal

articles.author: Darragh McDonald
articles.description: The Royals announced today that right-hander Hunter Harvey has been placed on the 15-day injured list due to a right adductor strain. Fellow righty Luinder Avila has been recalled in the corresponding move and will be making his major league debut as soon as he gets into a game. Harvey’s IL stint is another frustrating…
articles.title: Royals Place Hunter Harvey On Injured List

articles.author: Darragh McDonald
articles.description: The Royals announced, via their official player development account, that they have signed infielder/outfielder Bobby Dalbec to a minor league contract. He opted out of a minor league deal with the Brewers last week. He will presumably join Triple-A Omaha in the coming days. The book on Dalbec is well known around baseball at this…
articles.title: Royals Sign Bobby Dalbec To Minor League Deal

articles.author: Nick Deeds
articles.description: The trade deadline has come and gone. The full impact of these trades won’t be known for years to…

articles.description:
Taco Bell's digital deal schedule for August through mid-September 2025 is out. The offers include the chain's Tuesday Drops, in-app deals, and third-party delivery deals. 

Here are the deals coming up at Taco Bell:


Tuesday Drops


8/19/25 - $1 Nachos Bell Grande for the first 30,000 rewards members who claim the deal starting at 2PM PT (limit one use per person).


In-App Deals


8/17/25 - $0 delivery fee with a $25+ order.
8/22/25 to 8/24/25 - $0 delivery fee with a $25+ order.
9/4/25 - $0 delivery fee with the purchase of a Cantina Chicken menu item (excludes Avocado Verde Salsa Sauce packet).
9/6/25 to 9/8/25 - $0 delivery fee with the purchase of a Cantina Chicken menu item (excludes Avocado Verde Salsa Sauce packet).


Third-Party Delivery Deals


Through 8/20/25 - Get a free Cant…
articles.title: Taco Bell Digital Deals Through Mid-September 2025

articles.description:
Keebler launches new Spookie Fudge Stripes Cookies as a limited-edition Halloween variety of its signature Fudge Stripes cookies.

The festive cookies feature chocolaty vanilla-flavored cookies with orange stripes and Halloween-themed designs.
You can find 9.5-oz packages of Spookie Fudge Stripes Cookies rolling out at retailers nationwide. Prices vary by retailer, but a quick search yields a range of $3.38 to $5.49.
Photo via Keebler.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: New Keebler Spookie Fudge Stripes Cookies Arrive

articles.description:
Krispy Kreme partners with Warner Bros. Discovery Global Consumer Products to introduce the new Harry Potter: Houses of Hogwarts x Krispy Kreme Collection, which includes a themed donut for each Hogwarts House. There's also a special Sorting Hat Donut.

The donuts are available for a limited time starting Monday, August 18, 2025, at participating locations across the country. Here's what you can expect to find:


Gryffindor Donut - A shell donut filled with cookie butter-flavored Kreme, dipped in red icing and Biscoff cookie crumble, topped with golden icing drizzles and a Gryffindor crest. 
Slytherin Donut - An Original Glazed donut topped with chocolate and green buttercreme-flavored swirls, a chocolate cookie sugar blend, and a Slytherin crest. 
Hufflepuff Donut - A shell donut filled w…
articles.title: Krispy Kreme Introduces New Harry Potter Donuts with One for Each Hogwarts House

articles.description:
Because about 33% of Americans do their Halloween shopping before Labor Day, you can already find Halloween candies lining the shelves at many retailers in August. As one of the top candy manufacturers in the US, you can find a lot of Hershey's products for Halloween this year. Notable ones to pass out on Halloween this year include:



New Kit Kat Counts (pictured)- These feature a vampire shape and a wider wafer than regular Kit Kats. They're available in snack and jumbo-size assortment bags.
"It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown"-themed Reese's Pumpkins and Reese's Miniatures - The bags and wrappers sport Halloween-themed designs featuring the Peanuts Gang.
Hershey's Cookies 'n' Crème Harry Potter Magical Friends Collection - These come in decorative packaging and wrappers featuring ch…
articles.title: Hershey's Rolls Out 2025 Halloween Lineup

articles.description:
Taco Bell launches new Mountain Dew Baja Midnight as a permanent addition to its soda fountain.

The new, Taco Bell-exclusive soda flavor is purple with the taste of passion fruit mixed with the Mountain Dew Baja Blast (which is Mountain Dew plus tropical lime flavor). Like Mountain Dew Baja Blast, Mountain Dew Baja Midnight is available as a slush ice Freeze.
The suggested price for Mountain Dew Baja Midnight is $2.49 for a small, $2.79 for a medium, and $2.99 for a large.
The Mountain Dew Baja Midnight Freeze has a suggested price of $3.79 for a regular and $3.99 for a large. Like the fast-food chain's other Freeze and sodas, you can get a regular Freeze or a medium soda for $1 during Happier Hour, from 2 to 5PM, at participating locations.
On August 15, 2025, rewards members can get a free medium Mountain Dew Baja Midnight when spending $5 or more through the Taco Bell mobile app.
Photo via Taco Bell.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: Taco Bell Launches New Mountain Dew Baja Midnight

articles.description:
Little Debbie launches a new Pumpkin Spice Oatmeal Creme Pie as part of this year's fall product lineup.

A seasonal take on the brand's classic Oatmeal Creme Pie, the pumpkin spice rendition features two soft oatmeal cookies sandwiching a layer of pumpkin spice-flavored orange creme. A box of eight carries a suggested price of $3.19.
Other new products from Little Debbie for fall 2025 include:


Fall Mini Muffins - Buttery, bite-sized vanilla muffins baked with yellow, brown, and orange inclusions. A box of 5 pouches costs $3.19 (may vary)
Fall Gingerbread Cookies - Soft gingerbread cookies with a sugary crunch. They come 8 cookies to a carton for a suggested price of $3.19.
Club Pack Brownie Pumpkins - A 20-count Club Pack of Little Debbie Brownie Pumpkins for a suggested price of $12.75.


Other fall products back for the season include:


Apple Cinnamon Donut Sticks
Brownie Pumpkins (box of five)
Fall Party Cakes
Chocolate Fall Party Cakes
Fall Gingerbread Cookies
Pumpkin Delights
Pumpkin Spice Minit Donuts
Pumpkin Spice Rolls
Football Brownies (available through February 2026)


Little Debbie's fall snacks are now available at retailers nationwide for a limited time through late October 2025, while supplies last.
Photo via Little Debbie.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: New Little Debbie Pumpkin Spice Oatmeal Creme Pies Arrive as Part of Fall 2025 Lineup

articles.description:
Culver's partners with General Mills to launch a trio of new Cereal Concrete Mixers featuring three classic cereal brands.

Available for a limited time, the Cereal Concrete Mixers lineup includes:


Cocoa Puffs Concrete Mixer - Chocolaty cereal puffs mixed with chocolate or vanilla frozen custard.
Lucky Charms Concrete Mixer - Frosted oat cereal and colorful marshmallows mixed into vanilla or chocolate frozen custard.
Cinnamon Toast Crunch Concrete Mixer - Cinnamon Toast Crunch blended into vanilla or chocolate frozen custard.


To encourage customers to try all three flavors, Culver's is offering Cereal Concrete Mixer Flights, a dine-in option that includes three mini Concrete Mixers (one of each flavor) for the price of two.
Photo via Culver's.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: Culver's Debuts New Cereal Concrete Mixers

articles.description:
Subway is offering an exclusive 40% discount on Footlong subs online for a limited time to its rewards members.


The deal is available when ordering through the Subway website or mobile app using the code "FORTY".
The 40% off deal follows a buy-one-get-one-for-50% off deal that recently finished its run. It is available through September 8, 2025, at participating locations nationwide.
Subway also continues to offer its $6.99 Meal of the Day, which includes a 6" sub of the day (it changes each day of the week), a drink, and chips or two cookies.
Photo via Subway.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: 40% Off Footlong Subs at Subway

articles.description:
P.F. Chang's welcomes its new "Freakier Flavors" menu inspired by Disney's recently released Freakier Friday movie. Interestingly enough, the original Freaky Friday included a fictional House of Chiang restaurant (which sounds similar to P.F. Chang's), which the new menu pays tribute to.

P.F. Chang's new Freakier Friday-themed menu includes:


House of Chang's Spicy Chicken Dinner Special - Chang's Spicy Chicken served with white rice and an egg roll.
Mix It Up Mongolian Beef Dinner Special - Mongolian Beef served with white rice or lo mein and a house salad.
Switcheroo Refresher - Mango-orange lemonade that changes color and shimmers.
Crystal Ball Refresher - A mix of desert pear, lemonade, Sprite, and club soda that changes color and shimmers.
Pink Slip Ube Cheesecake - Vanilla cheesecake base topped with a creamy, nutty ube layer, made from purple sweet potato (ube), and topped with edible pink glitter.


The Freakier Flavors menu is available now for a limited time at most P.F. Chang's locations nationwide through September 2, 2025.
Photo via P.F. Chang's.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: P.F. Chang's Introduces New Freakier Friday Menu

articles.description:
Little Caesars is offering a limited-time, online-only deal where you can get a large, two-topping Crazy Crust Pizza for $6.99.

The deal can be redeemed by using the promo code "JUSTCRUSTUS" when ordering through the Little Caesars website or mobile app at participating locations nationwide (except Alaska and Hawaii).
Little Caesars' Crazy Crust is the chain's regular crust brushed at the edge with a buttery-flavored garlic spread and sprinkled with Parmesan (in the same manner as the chain's Crazy Bread).
A large, two-topping Crazy Crust Pizza is normally $11.99 at my local Little Caesars restaurant in Los Angeles.
Photo via Little Caesars.
Read more at Brand Eating!
articles.title: Little Caesars Offers Large Two-Topping Crazy Crust Pizza for $6.99
